meanings.definition: A type of duck with a distinctive long, pointed tail.
meanings.sent1: The pintails waddled by the pond, showing off their long tails.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of pintails swimming gracefully in the lake.
meanings.sent3: Why did the pintails always win the tail-wagging contest? Because of their long, pointy tails!
meanings.sent4: Her hair flowed behind her like the pintails of a duck, elegant and slender.
meanings.sent5: The pintails' tails were like arrows pointing to the sky, a beautiful sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The long, pointed tail feathers of a bird.
meanings.sent1: The bird's pintails fluttered in the wind as it took flight.
meanings.sent2: I collected a few pintails I found on the forest floor for my nature project.
meanings.sent3: The bird was so proud of its pintails, it preened them every chance it got.
meanings.sent4: Her dress train trailed behind her like the pintails of a majestic bird.
meanings.sent5: The pintails of the peacock shimmered in the sunlight, a display of nature's beauty.
